creator: gmazza@apache.org
text:
JSR 109 (also explained here[1]) mandates that web services place their WSDL's
and XSD's within the WEB-INF/wsdl directory.  The WAR task presently has
classes, webinf, metainf, and lib nested elements[2] for file placement in those
directories, but no "wsdl" nested element yet.  This forces the user to use
<zipfileset/> instead to get the WSDLs/XSD's in the proper location in the WAR file.

I would like to see a "wsdl" nested element added in to the WAR task so we don't
need to use zipfileset for that.

[1] http://blogs.sun.com/manveen/entry/converting_an_existing_webservice_to
[2] http://ant.apache.org/manual/CoreTasks/war.html

Glen, 
I'm against this.

-Ws-* is a complete mess that we don't want to encourage any more of. That said,
 including proper WSDL instead of relying on inferring the service API from the
Java can only be a good thing

-<zipfileset  prefix="WEB-INF/wsdl" /> is not that hard

-If it were to be added, we'd need new tests and docs

I'm not going to -1 the change, just not going do any of the work myself. If you
really want this, please provide patches and new (Antunit) tests
